Steps to reproduce:

(sorry for my bad english)

I choose any addon at the page https://addons.mozilla.org/, and I click on "Add to Firefox" and soon I try to move any open tab (page).


Actual results:

Firefox crashs when the window opens to install the addon. (The tab I still keep on the mouse). 


Expected results:

It happened to me then that I could not click anywhere, just disable firefox through background processes and it created on my desktop a transparent thumbnail image of the page which you can see when you move the tab.

So such a small detail, I do not know if it makes just me, or the other

I could reproduce that on 7.0.1, Win XP. When the install window appeared the transparent thumbnail of the moved tab stayed on the screen but the mouse moved around freely. The addon window didn't get mouse button presses.
But somehow I got out of the state, keyboard partially worked.
On FF 10, I could not yet reproduce, it has a much changed tab moving animation and does not have the transparent thumbnail of moved tab. Maybe it does make a difference.

comments.raw_text:
On Firefox 10, try this:
1. Disable FF warning when a site tries to install addons (or make exception for AMO).
2. Drag a tab down from the tabbar (detach it), you get a nontransparent thumbnail. You can drag even the active AMO tab. Dropping the tab would move it to a new window. But don't do it.
4. Move it around the screen and wait for the "install addon" window to appear.
5. When it does, the dragging movement become choppy, it freezes for moments and then continues.
6. Move to tab back to the tab bar (as if you decided to cancel the drag)
7. Cancel the install window (mouse works).
8. Immediately after that, the tab jumps back into the drag mode, to the current mouse position (is teared from tabbar as in step 3.)
9. Move the tab around, notice you don't need to have the mouse button pressed (it is locked in pressed position by itself)
10. Drag it back to the tab bar and press mouse button.
11. The drag mode stops and FF is in normal mode again.
comments.author: acelists@atlas.sk
